1 repos

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/watchTowr-vs-progress-moveit_CVE-2024-5806

raptor at 2024-07-07T15:45:26.525Z ##

Auth. Bypass In (Un)Limited Scenarios - Progress #MOVEit Transfer (CVE-2024-5806)

https://labs.watchtowr.com/auth-bypass-in-un-limited-scenarios-progress-moveit-transfer-cve-2024-5806/

##
catc0n at 2024-07-01T23:44:20.810Z ##

Rapid7 analysis of #MOVEit Transfer #CVE_2024_5806 c/o @stephenfewer, with an assist from @fuzz. Notably, this exploit method is different from the one published last week — Rapid7's exploit achieves the auth bypass by manipulating the username supplied client-side during the SSH protocol's public key auth exchange with the server. As a result, both exploitability and IOCs are different. This also doesn't rely on what appears to be a new 0day for exploitation, though that was an interesting (if surprising) method.
https://attackerkb.com/topics/44EZLG2xgL/cve-2024-5806/rapid7-analysis

##
raptor@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-07T15:45:26.000Z ##

https://labs.watchtowr.com/auth-bypass-in-un-limited-scenarios-progress-moveit-transfer-cve-2024-5806/

CVE-2023-44487
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 73.19%

updated 2024-06-21T21:34:00

2 posts

## HTTP/2 Rapid reset attack The HTTP/2 protocol allows clients to indicate to the server that a previous stream should be canceled by sending a RST_STREAM frame. The protocol does not require the client and server to coordinate the cancellation in any way, the client may do it unilaterally. The client may also assume that the cancellation will take effect immediately when the server receives the

13 repos

https://github.com/sigridou/CVE-2023-44487-

CVE-2023-21939

updated 2024-06-21T19:15:25.230000

2 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition product of Oracle Java SE (component: Swing). ##

CVE-2023-51765
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.17%

updated 2024-06-15T09:15:11.253000

2 posts

sendmail through 8.17.2 allows SMTP smuggling in certain configurations. Remote attackers can use a published exploitation technique to inject e-mail messages with a spoofed MAIL FROM address, allowing bypass of an SPF protection mechanism. This occurs because sendmail supports <LF>.<CR><LF> but some other popular e-mail servers do not. This is resolved in 8.18 and later versions with 'o' in srv_f

alanc@fosstodon.org at 2024-07-09T17:37:37.000Z ##

Stacey Marshall, the current sendmail maintainer for #OracleSolaris, has blogged about disabling the CR+LF requirements for SMTP newly enforced in Solaris 11.4.68 and later due to the fix for CVE-2023-51765, for sites stuck with non-compliant SMTP senders:
https://staceymarshall.wordpress.com/2024/07/09/configuring-sendmail-srv_feature/

(Though that should be a short-term solution until you can get the software senders updated to follow the SMTP RFCs.)

##
alanc@fosstodon.org at 2024-07-09T17:37:37.000Z ##

Stacey Marshall, the current sendmail maintainer for #OracleSolaris, has blogged about disabling the CR+LF requirements for SMTP newly enforced in Solaris 11.4.68 and later due to the fix for CVE-2023-51765, for sites stuck with non-compliant SMTP senders:
https://staceymarshall.wordpress.com/2024/07/09/configuring-sendmail-srv_feature/

(Though that should be a short-term solution until you can get the software senders updated to follow the SMTP RFCs.)

##

CVE-2024-34447
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-14T13:15:51.950000

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Bouncy Castle Java Cryptography APIs before BC 1.78. When endpoint identification is enabled in the BCJSSE and an SSL socket is created without an explicit hostname (as happens with HttpsURLConnection), hostname verification could be performed against a DNS-resolved IP address in some situations, opening up a possibility of DNS poisoning.

##

CVE-2024-20666
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:06

1 posts

BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

2 repos

https://github.com/nnotwen/Script-For-CVE-2024-20666

https://github.com/invaderslabs/CVE-2024-20666

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T19:25:14.000Z ##

Fake #IT support sites push malicious #PowerShell scripts as #Windows fixes

Threat actors are creating fake tech support sites, promoting them via compromised YouTube creator accounts. These fake sites instruct users to run (malicious) PowerShell scripts that call information-stealing malware.

Specifically, threat actors are targeting the Windows “0x80070643 error” introduced after #Microsoft addressed a BitLocker encryption bypass flaw (tracked as CVE-2024-20666) - affected users are actively searching for fixes, which may lead to stumbling upon these fake sites.

#security #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fake-it-support-sites-push-malicious-powershell-scripts-as-windows-fixes/

##

CVE-2024-21412
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.23%

updated 2024-06-11T15:16:02.980000

8 posts

Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-07-05T13:40:02.187Z ##

Cyble: Increase in the exploitation of Microsoft SmartScreen vulnerability CVE-2024-21412
Cyble warns of an active campaign exploiting the Microsoft SmartScreen vulnerability CVE-2024-21412 (8.1 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day). Targets are currently Spain, Australia and the U.S., using lures related to healthcare insurance schemes, transportation notices, and tax-related communications. This campaign delivers Lumma and Meduza Stealer as its final payloads. IOC and Yara rule provided.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_21412 #infostealer #lummac2 #meduza #ioc

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T21:36:30.284Z ##

SonicWall: A Deep Dive Into DarkME Rat Malware
SonicWall provides a technical analysis of DarkME RAT malware. They only mention CVE-2024-21412 once: It is a Microsoft Windows Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (CVSSv3.1: 8.1 high severity) leveraged by the financially motivated Water Hydra (DarkCasino) APT during a a spike in DarkME RAT distribution in February 2024. While SonicWall describes the infection chain and the RAT's features, they do NOT provide IOC. I'm not going to handjam the SHA256 from a VirusTotal screenshot.

#Darkme #DarkGate #WaterHydra #DarkCasino #APT #malwareanalysis #CVE_2024_21412 #threatintel

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-05T13:40:02.000Z ##

Cyble warns of an active campaign exploiting the Microsoft SmartScreen vulnerability CVE-2024-21412 (8.1 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day). Targets are currently Spain, Australia and the U.S., using lures related to healthcare insurance schemes, transportation notices, and tax-related communications. This campaign delivers Lumma and Meduza Stealer as its final payloads. IOC and Yara rule provided.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_21412 #infostealer #lummac2 #meduza #ioc

CVE-2024-21887
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.85%

updated 2024-06-10T16:21:07.127000

2 posts

A command injection vulnerability in web components of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows an authenticated administrator to send specially crafted requests and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance.

Nuclei template

12 repos

https://github.com/gobysec/Goby

https://github.com/gobysec/GobyVuls

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/yoryio/CVE-2023-46805

https://github.com/seajaysec/Ivanti-Connect-Around-Scan

https://github.com/imhunterand/CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/tucommenceapousser/CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/duy-31/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887

screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T17:44:38.904Z ##

CISA: Secure by Design Alert: Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities
CISA and FBI are releasing their newest Secure by Design Alert in the series, Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities, in response to recent well-publicized threat actor campaigns that exploited OS command injection defects in network edge devices (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, CVE-2024-21887) to target and compromise users. These vulnerabilities allowed unauthenticated malicious actors to remotely execute code on network edge devices.
OS command injection vulnerabilities have long been preventable by clearly separating user input from the contents of a command. Despite this finding, OS command injection vulnerabilities—many of which result from CWE-78—are still a prevalent class of vulnerability. 4 page PDF

#CISA #securebydesign

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-10T17:44:38.000Z ##

CISA: Secure by Design Alert: Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities
CISA and FBI are releasing their newest Secure by Design Alert in the series, Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities, in response to recent well-publicized threat actor campaigns that exploited OS command injection defects in network edge devices (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, CVE-2024-21887) to target and compromise users. These vulnerabilities allowed unauthenticated malicious actors to remotely execute code on network edge devices.
OS command injection vulnerabilities have long been preventable by clearly separating user input from the contents of a command. Despite this finding, OS command injection vulnerabilities—many of which result from CWE-78—are still a prevalent class of vulnerability. 4 page PDF

#CISA #securebydesign

##

CVE-2024-3400
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.70%

updated 2024-05-29T16:00:24.093000

2 posts

A command injection as a result of arbitrary file creation vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall. Cloud NGFW, Panorama appliances, and Prisma Access are not impacted by this vulnerability.

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T17:44:38.904Z ##

CISA: Secure by Design Alert: Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities
CISA and FBI are releasing their newest Secure by Design Alert in the series, Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities, in response to recent well-publicized threat actor campaigns that exploited OS command injection defects in network edge devices (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, CVE-2024-21887) to target and compromise users. These vulnerabilities allowed unauthenticated malicious actors to remotely execute code on network edge devices.
OS command injection vulnerabilities have long been preventable by clearly separating user input from the contents of a command. Despite this finding, OS command injection vulnerabilities—many of which result from CWE-78—are still a prevalent class of vulnerability. 4 page PDF

#CISA #securebydesign

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-10T17:44:38.000Z ##

CISA: Secure by Design Alert: Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities
CISA and FBI are releasing their newest Secure by Design Alert in the series, Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities, in response to recent well-publicized threat actor campaigns that exploited OS command injection defects in network edge devices (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, CVE-2024-21887) to target and compromise users. These vulnerabilities allowed unauthenticated malicious actors to remotely execute code on network edge devices.
OS command injection vulnerabilities have long been preventable by clearly separating user input from the contents of a command. Despite this finding, OS command injection vulnerabilities—many of which result from CWE-78—are still a prevalent class of vulnerability. 4 page PDF

#CISA #securebydesign

CVE-2023-24068
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-17T02:20:11.750000

2 posts

Signal Desktop before 6.2.0 on Windows, Linux, and macOS allows an attacker to modify conversation attachments within the attachments.noindex directory. Client mechanisms fail to validate modifications of existing cached files, resulting in an attacker's ability to insert malicious code into pre-existing attachments or replace them completely. A threat actor can forward the existing attachment in

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T17:23:48.901Z ##

Group-IB: Patch or Peril: A Veeam vulnerability incident
EstateRansomware (one word) is a new ransomware group that's exploiting CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high, disclosed 07 March 2023 by Veeam) Veeam Backup & Replication Cloud Connect Missing Authentication for Critical Function Vulnerability. The blog provides an overview of the attacker’s tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), from initial access via FortiGate SSL VPN to the impact of the ransomware. IOC provided.

#threatintel #EstateRansomware #ransomware #ioc #CVE_2023_27532 #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2023-38408
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.75%

updated 2024-04-19T05:07:56

2 posts

The PKCS#11 feature in ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 9.3p2 has an insufficiently trustworthy search path, leading to remote code execution if an agent is forwarded to an attacker-controlled system. (Code in /usr/lib is not necessarily safe for loading into ssh-agent.) NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-10009.

4 repos

https://github.com/classic130/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/wxrdnx/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/LucasPDiniz/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/kali-mx/CVE-2023-38408

ckure at 2024-07-02T03:00:00.659Z ##

@4Dgifts @wdormann I think log4j just from the bonkers exploitability surface area. Somebody just drops some jndi string into a device name or form field and some system far removed just goes to grab some Java class & runs it. I also really liked the creativity in CVE-2023-38408 (OpenSSH ssh-agent RCE); but if the Qualys folks write anything up, it just makes me smile.

##
ckure@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T03:00:00.000Z ##

@4Dgifts @wdormann I think log4j just from the bonkers exploitability surface area. Somebody just drops some jndi string into a device name or form field and some system far removed just goes to grab some Java class & runs it. I also really liked the creativity in CVE-2023-38408 (OpenSSH ssh-agent RCE); but if the Qualys folks write anything up, it just makes me smile.

They provide an overview of the protocol used for both the RCE and DoS (CVE-2023-29464) vulnerabilities.

CVE-2024-3094
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 14.71%

updated 2024-03-29T18:30:50

2 posts

Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0. The tarballs included extra .m4 files, which contained instructions for building with automake that did not exist in the repository. These instructions, through a series of complex obfuscations, extract a prebuilt object file from one of the test archives, which is then used to modify specific functions in t

Nuclei template

decio at 2024-07-02T08:01:53.051Z ##

Résumé de l'impact de la vuln CVE-2024-6387 par distribution :linux:

  • Debian :debian: :

Debian 11 : non impacté ;
Debian 12 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.2p1-deb12u3 ;
Debian SID : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.7p1-7.
⬇️
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-6387

  • Alpine Linux Edge :alpinelinux: :
    xz-utils versions inférieures à 5.6.1-r2
    ⬇️
    https://security.alpinelinux.org/vuln/CVE-2024-3094

  • ArchLinux :archlinux: :
    Sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 9.8p1-1.
    ⬇️
    https://security.archlinux.org/ASA-202407-1

  • Oracle Linux :
    Oracle Linux 6 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 7 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 8 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 9 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 8.7p1-38.0.2.el9.
    ⬇️
    https://linux.oracle.com/errata/ELSA-2024-12468.html

  • Red Hat :redhat: :
    RHEL 6 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 7 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 8 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 9 : toutes les versions sont vulnérables (correctif en cours de préparation).
    ⬇️
    https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2024-6387

  • Ubuntu :ubuntu: :
    Ubuntu 22.04 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.10 ;
    Ubuntu 23.10 :sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.3p1-1ubuntu3.6 ;
    Ubuntu 24.04 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.6p1-3ubuntu13.3.
    ⬇️
    https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-6859-1

Mitigation possible avec Fail2Ban & co et selon RedHat
⬇️
"Ce problème peut être résolu en définissant le paramètre LoginGraceTime à 0 dans le fichier de configuration de sshd.
1) En tant qu'utilisateur root, ouvrez le fichier /etc/ssh/sshd_config
2) Ajoutez ou modifiez la configuration du paramètre :
LoginGraceTime 0
3) Sauvegardez et fermez le fichier
4) Redémarrez le démon sshd :
systemctl restart sshd.service
Notez que le serveur sshd sera toujours vulnérable aux attaques par déni de service en raison de la possibilité d'épuisement des connexions MaxStartups, mais qu'il sera protégé contre les éventuelles attaques par exécution de code à distance."

Bon résumé en FR
👇
https://cyberwatch.fr/cve/cve-2024-6387-regresshion-detectez-et-corrigez-cette-vulnerabilite-sur-openssh/

Pour les "objets connectés" exposés ça va être dur, dur…

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_6387

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T08:01:53.000Z ##

Résumé de l'impact de la vuln CVE-2024-6387 par distribution :linux:

  • Debian :debian: :

Debian 11 : non impacté ;
Debian 12 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.2p1-deb12u3 ;
Debian SID : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.7p1-7.
⬇️
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-6387

  • Alpine Linux Edge :alpinelinux: :
    xz-utils versions inférieures à 5.6.1-r2
    ⬇️
    https://security.alpinelinux.org/vuln/CVE-2024-3094

  • ArchLinux :archlinux: :
    Sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 9.8p1-1.
    ⬇️
    https://security.archlinux.org/ASA-202407-1

  • Oracle Linux :
    Oracle Linux 6 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 7 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 8 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 9 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 8.7p1-38.0.2.el9.
    ⬇️
    https://linux.oracle.com/errata/ELSA-2024-12468.html

  • Red Hat :redhat: :
    RHEL 6 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 7 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 8 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 9 : toutes les versions sont vulnérables (correctif en cours de préparation).
    ⬇️
    https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2024-6387

  • Ubuntu :ubuntu: :
    Ubuntu 22.04 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.10 ;
    Ubuntu 23.10 :sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.3p1-1ubuntu3.6 ;
    Ubuntu 24.04 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.6p1-3ubuntu13.3.
    ⬇️
    https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-6859-1

Mitigation possible avec Fail2Ban & co et selon RedHat
⬇️
"Ce problème peut être résolu en définissant le paramètre LoginGraceTime à 0 dans le fichier de configuration de sshd.
1) En tant qu'utilisateur root, ouvrez le fichier /etc/ssh/sshd_config
2) Ajoutez ou modifiez la configuration du paramètre :
LoginGraceTime 0
3) Sauvegardez et fermez le fichier
4) Redémarrez le démon sshd :
systemctl restart sshd.service
Notez que le serveur sshd sera toujours vulnérable aux attaques par déni de service en raison de la possibilité d'épuisement des connexions MaxStartups, mais qu'il sera protégé contre les éventuelles attaques par exécution de code à distance."

Bon résumé en FR
👇
https://cyberwatch.fr/cve/cve-2024-6387-regresshion-detectez-et-corrigez-cette-vulnerabilite-sur-openssh/

Pour les "objets connectés" exposés ça va être dur, dur…

CVE-2023-2650
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.15%

updated 2024-02-04T09:15:09.643000

4 posts

Issue summary: Processing some specially crafted ASN.1 object identifiers or data containing them may be very slow. Impact summary: Applications that use OBJ_obj2txt() directly, or use any of the OpenSSL subsystems OCSP, PKCS7/SMIME, CMS, CMP/CRMF or TS with no message size limit may experience notable to very long delays when processing those messages, which may lead to a Denial of Service. An

1 repos

https://github.com/hshivhare67/OpenSSL_1.1.1g_CVE-2023-2650

##

CVE-2024-0456
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-01-31T20:12:00.077000

4 posts

An authorization vulnerability exists in GitLab versions 14.0 prior to 16.6.6, 16.7 prior to 16.7.4, and 16.8 prior to 16.8.1. An unauthorized attacker is able to assign arbitrary users to MRs that they created within the project

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T16:42:32.713Z ##

Cisco security advisory: Cisco IOS XR Software Secure Boot Bypass Vulnerability
CVE-2024-20456 (6.7 medium)

A vulnerability in the boot process of Cisco IOS XR Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker with high privileges to bypass the Cisco Secure Boot functionality and load unverified software on an affected device. To exploit this successfully, the attacker must have root-system privileges on the affected device.

This vulnerability is due to an error in the software build process. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by manipulating the system’s configuration options to bypass some of the integrity checks that are performed during the booting process. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to control the boot configuration, which could enable them to bypass of the requirement to run Cisco signed images or alter the security properties of the running system.

Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

#CVE_202420456 #Cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-10T16:42:32.000Z ##

CVE-2024-20456 (6.7 medium)

This vulnerability is due to an error in the software build process. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by manipulating the system’s configuration options to bypass some of the integrity checks that are performed during the booting process. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to control the boot configuration, which could enable them to bypass of the requirement to run Cisco signed images or alter the security properties of the running system.

Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

##

CVE-2024-0769
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2024-01-21T09:30:39

1 posts

** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** A vulnerability was found in D-Link DIR-859 1.06B01. It has been rated as critical. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /hedwig.cgi of the component HTTP POST Request Handler. The manipulation of the argument service with the input ../../../../htdocs/webinc/getcfg/DHCPS6.BRIDGE-1.xml leads to path traversal. The attack may be launched re

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T20:55:12.000Z ##

#Hackers exploit critical D-Link DIR-859 router flaw to steal passwords

Threat actors are using slight variations of the publicly available exploit code for CVE-2024-0769 to extract account details from the router.

This could lead to compromise of the router.

Note: this particular router model has reached end-of-life according to D-Link.

This highlights the importance of not using end-of-life devices or software where possible. Depending on the router model, when it is end-of-life, you may be able to flash it with opensource firmware to extend its life. This isn't always possible, though, and users are advised to get a new(er) device ASAP.

#security #cybersecurity #cve

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hackers-exploit-critical-d-link-dir-859-router-flaw-to-steal-passwords/

##

CVE-2021-3781
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.34%

updated 2023-06-26T18:56:25.007000

1 posts

A trivial sandbox (enabled with the `-dSAFER` option) escape flaw was found in the ghostscript interpreter by injecting a specially crafted pipe command. This flaw allows a specially crafted document to execute arbitrary commands on the system in the context of the ghostscript interpreter. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

caspicat at 2024-07-04T07:15:57.031Z ##

@llimllib @hrbrmstr

Interesting, because the blog has this timeline
> 2024-05-02: Ghostscript 10.03.1 released which mitigates the issue

In the past, there were multiple 0day GS exploits in the wild. Can you confirm that it wasn't one of the old exploits like CVE-2021-3781 in your case?

https://bugs.ghostscript.com/show_bug.cgi?id=704342

Two large instances patched yesterday.

vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-07-08T15:10:21.000Z ##

96 hours later, and 68.7% of Mastodon instances have patched for CVE-2024-37903 providing coverage for 86.7% of Mastodon users.

#mastoadmin #CVE202437903

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-07-07T15:16:32.000Z ##

72 hours later, and 64.9% of Mastodon instances have patched for CVE-2024-37903 providing coverage for 86.4% of Mastodon users.

For some reason, 12 of the top 100 instances (6 of the top 25) by active users have yet to patch. Once this happens total user coverage should jump significantly.

The long tail is always instances that have less than ten users. They make up 71% of instances but only represent 0.27% of total users.

#mastoadmin #CVE202437903

jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-07-08T07:52:35.000Z ##

Ah, yes. So the security issue that caused the surprise update to #Mastodon 4.2.10 on the 4th of July has a name: CVE-2024-37903 Improper authorship check on audience extension for existing posts

More details will be published on the 15th of July.
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-xjvf-fm67-4qc3

##
schizanon@mastodon.social at 2024-07-06T14:56:41.000Z ##

> by crafting specific activities, an attacker can extend the audience of a post they do not own to other Mastodon users on a target server, thus gaining access to the contents of a post not intended for them

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-37903

CVE-2024-6151
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-07-09T16:20:30.550Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Citrix:

  • Windows Virtual Delivery Agent for CVAD and Citrix DaaS Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6151 (CVSSv4: 8.5 high) Local Privilege escalation allows a low-privileged user to gain SYSTEM privileges
  • Citrix Provisioning Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6150 (CVSSv4: 4.8 medium) A non-admin user can cause short-term disruption in Target VM availability (An attacker must have access to the PVSboot.ini file)
  • Citrix Workspace app for Windows Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6286 (CVSSv4: 8.5 high) Local Privilege escalation allows a low-privileged user to gain SYSTEM privileges
  • Citrix Workspace app for HTML5 Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6148 (5.3 medium) Bypass of GACS Policy Configuration settings and CVE-2024-6149 (4.8 medium) Redirection of users to a vulnerable URL
  • NetScaler Console, Agent and SVM Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6235 (9.4 critical) Sensitive information disclosure and CVE-2024-6236 (7.1 high) Denial of Service
  • NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Security Bulletin CVE-2024-5491 (7.1 high) Denial of Service and CVE-2024-5492 (5.1 medium) Open redirect vulnerability allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to redirect users to arbitrary websites

No mention of exploitation.

#Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_6151 #CVE_2024_6150

  • Citrix Provisioning Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6150 (CVSSv4: 4.8 medium) A non-admin user can cause short-term disruption in Target VM availability (An attacker must have access to the PVSboot.ini file)
  • Citrix Workspace app for Windows Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6286 (CVSSv4: 8.5 high) Local Privilege escalation allows a low-privileged user to gain SYSTEM privileges
  • Citrix Workspace app for HTML5 Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6148 (5.3 medium) Bypass of GACS Policy Configuration settings and CVE-2024-6149 (4.8 medium) Redirection of users to a vulnerable URL
  • NetScaler Console, Agent and SVM Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6235 (9.4 critical) Sensitive information disclosure and CVE-2024-6236 (7.1 high) Denial of Service
  • NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Security Bulletin CVE-2024-5491 (7.1 high) Denial of Service and CVE-2024-5492 (5.1 medium) Open redirect vulnerability allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to redirect users to arbitrary websites

No mention of exploitation.

  • Windows Virtual Delivery Agent for CVAD and Citrix DaaS Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6151 (CVSSv4: 8.5 high) Local Privilege escalation allows a low-privileged user to gain SYSTEM privileges
  • Citrix Provisioning Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6150 (CVSSv4: 4.8 medium) A non-admin user can cause short-term disruption in Target VM availability (An attacker must have access to the PVSboot.ini file)
  • Citrix Workspace app for Windows Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6286 (CVSSv4: 8.5 high) Local Privilege escalation allows a low-privileged user to gain SYSTEM privileges
  • Citrix Workspace app for HTML5 Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6148 (5.3 medium) Bypass of GACS Policy Configuration settings and CVE-2024-6149 (4.8 medium) Redirection of users to a vulnerable URL
  • NetScaler Console, Agent and SVM Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6235 (9.4 critical) Sensitive information disclosure and CVE-2024-6236 (7.1 high) Denial of Service
  • NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Security Bulletin CVE-2024-5491 (7.1 high) Denial of Service and CVE-2024-5492 (5.1 medium) Open redirect vulnerability allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to redirect users to arbitrary websites

No mention of exploitation.

#Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_6151 #CVE_2024_6150

##

  • Citrix Provisioning Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6150 (CVSSv4: 4.8 medium) A non-admin user can cause short-term disruption in Target VM availability (An attacker must have access to the PVSboot.ini file)
  • Citrix Workspace app for Windows Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6286 (CVSSv4: 8.5 high) Local Privilege escalation allows a low-privileged user to gain SYSTEM privileges
  • Citrix Workspace app for HTML5 Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6148 (5.3 medium) Bypass of GACS Policy Configuration settings and CVE-2024-6149 (4.8 medium) Redirection of users to a vulnerable URL
  • NetScaler Console, Agent and SVM Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6235 (9.4 critical) Sensitive information disclosure and CVE-2024-6236 (7.1 high) Denial of Service
  • NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Security Bulletin CVE-2024-5491 (7.1 high) Denial of Service and CVE-2024-5492 (5.1 medium) Open redirect vulnerability allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to redirect users to arbitrary websites

screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T12:24:09.349Z ##

@shellsharks According to The Hacker News, CVE-2024-37985 (5.9 medium, disclosed 09 July 2024 by Microsoft) "Arm: CVE-2024-37985 Systematic Identification and Characterization of Proprietary Prefetchers" is a a side-channel attack called FetchBench.

Here is a non paywall 15 page PDF: https://publications.cispa.saarland/3991/1/ccs23-fetchbench.pdf

#FetchBench #CVE_2024_37985 #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE

Microsoft Patch Tuesday July 2024

(Pic 1) List of KBs released corresponding to each OS

(Pic 2) List of Zero-days released(2 of them exploited in-the-wild already)

**Patch CVE-2024-38080 and CVE-2024-38112 NOW !!

CVE-2024-38080(Zero-day Exploited-in-the-wild): https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38080

CVE-2024-38112(Zero-day Exploited-in-the-wild): https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38112

CVE-2024-35264: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-35264

CVE-2024-37985: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-37985

List of Vulnerabilities addressed in Patch Tuesday July 2024:

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-us/releaseNote/2024-Jul

screaminggoat at 2024-07-09T17:09:01.308Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 142 vulnerabilities, FOUR zero days

  • CVE-2024-38112 (7.5 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability (EXPLOITED ONLY)
  • CVE-2024-38080 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED ONLY)
  • CVE-2024-37985 (5.9 medium) Arm: CVE-2024-37985 Systematic Identification and Characterization of Proprietary Prefetchers (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED ONLY)
  • CVE-2024-35264 (8.1 high) .NET and Visual Studio Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED ONLY)

VMware security advisory: VMSA-2024-0017
CVE-2024-22280 (8.5 high) SQL-injection vulnerability in VMware Aria Automation: An authenticated malicious user could enter specially crafted SQL queries and perform unauthorised read/write operations in the database. No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-5910
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T16:48:15.050Z ##

Palo Alto Networks multiple security advisories:

  • PAN-SA-2024-0006 Informational Bulletin: Expedition Installation Script Resets Root Password
  • Expedition: Missing Authentication Leads to Admin Account Takeover CVE-2024-5910 (9.3 critical)
  • PAN-OS: File Upload Vulnerability in the Panorama Web Interface CVE-2024-5911 (7.0 high)
  • Cortex XDR Agent: Improper File Signature Verification Checks CVE-2024-5912 (6.8 medium)
  • PAN-OS: Improper Input Validation Vulnerability in PAN-OS CVE-2024-5913 (5.4 medium)
  • PAN-OS: CHAP and PAP When Used with RADIUS Authentication Lead to Privilege Escalation CVE-2024-3596 (5.3 medium, aka #BlastRADIUS)
    • Palo Alto Networks is aware of proof of concept code demonstrating how to exploit this generic issue.

Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue.

#PaloAltoNetworks #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability

- CVE-2024-6447 Unauthenticated Stored Cross-Site Scripting via License Plan Parameter https://www.wordfence.com/threat-intel/vulnerabilities/wordpress-plugins/full-customer/full-3112-unauthenticated-stored-cross-site-scripting-via-license-plan-parameter #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-6235
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

5 posts

N/A

AAKL at 2024-07-10T14:19:52.267Z ##

If you missed this, #Citrix has patched critical #NetScaler Console vulnerability CVE-2024-6235. More here: https://support.citrix.com/knowledge-center#/search?searchText=&ct=Security%20Bulletins&product=All%20Products&sortBy=Created%20date&pageIndex=1 #cybersecurity #infosec

Via @SecurityWeek https://www.securityweek.com/citrix-patches-critical-netscaler-console-vulnerability/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-07-10T07:06:39.646Z ##

Critical: CVE-2024-6235 :: CVSS v4 Score 9.4

Information Disclosure due to Improper Authentication in Citrix NetScaler Console !!

Official Advisory:

https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX677998/netscaler-console-agent-and-svm-security-bulletin-for-cve20246235-and-cve20246236

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-09T16:20:30.550Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Citrix:

  • Windows Virtual Delivery Agent for CVAD and Citrix DaaS Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6151 (CVSSv4: 8.5 high) Local Privilege escalation allows a low-privileged user to gain SYSTEM privileges
  • Citrix Provisioning Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6150 (CVSSv4: 4.8 medium) A non-admin user can cause short-term disruption in Target VM availability (An attacker must have access to the PVSboot.ini file)
  • Citrix Workspace app for Windows Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6286 (CVSSv4: 8.5 high) Local Privilege escalation allows a low-privileged user to gain SYSTEM privileges
  • Citrix Workspace app for HTML5 Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6148 (5.3 medium) Bypass of GACS Policy Configuration settings and CVE-2024-6149 (4.8 medium) Redirection of users to a vulnerable URL
  • NetScaler Console, Agent and SVM Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6235 (9.4 critical) Sensitive information disclosure and CVE-2024-6236 (7.1 high) Denial of Service
  • NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Security Bulletin CVE-2024-5491 (7.1 high) Denial of Service and CVE-2024-5492 (5.1 medium) Open redirect vulnerability allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to redirect users to arbitrary websites

No mention of exploitation.

#Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_6151 #CVE_2024_6150

  • Citrix Workspace app for HTML5 Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6148 (5.3 medium) Bypass of GACS Policy Configuration settings and CVE-2024-6149 (4.8 medium) Redirection of users to a vulnerable URL
  • NetScaler Console, Agent and SVM Security Bulletin CVE-2024-6235 (9.4 critical) Sensitive information disclosure and CVE-2024-6236 (7.1 high) Denial of Service

screaminggoat at 2024-07-09T16:00:59.897Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-23-485 CVE-2024-26006 (7.5 high) Cross site scripting vulnerability in SSL VPN web UI
  • FG-IR-24-073 CVE-2024-27785 (5.4 medium) FortiAIOps - CSV Injection in export device inventory feature
  • FG-IR-24-070 CVE-2024-27783 (7.6 high) FortiAIOps - Cross-site request forgery
  • FG-IR-24-069 CVE-2024-27782 (8.1 high) FortiAIOps - Improper Session Management
  • FG-IR-24-072 CVE-2024-27784 (8.8 high) FortiAIOps - Sensitive Information leak to an Unauthorized Actor
  • FG-IR-23-446 CVE-2024-26015 (3.4 low) FortiOS - IP address validation mishandles zero characters
  • FG-IR-23-469 CVE-2023-50181 (4.9 medium) Improper access control vulnerability in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-011 CVE-2024-21759 (4.3 medium) Insecure Direct Object Reference in policy API Endpoint
  • FG-IR-22-298 CVE-2023-50178 (7.4 high) Multiple lack of client-side certificate validation when establishing secure connections
  • FG-IR-24-258 CVE-2024-6387 (8.1 high) OpenSSH #regreSSHion Attack (CVE-2024-6387)
  • FG-IR-23-459 CVE-2024-23663 (8.8 high) Privilege escalation from low privilege administrator
  • FG-IR-23-480 CVE-2023-50179 (4.8 medium) [FortiADC] Lack of client-side certificate validation when establishing secure connections with public SDN connectors
  • FG-IR-22-326 CVE-2024-33509 (4.8 medium) [FortiWeb] Lack of client-side certificate validation when establishing secure connections

No mention of exploitation.

#Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T13:39:39.844Z ##

SecureLayer7: Major Security Flaws in Mailcow: Inside the XSS and Path Traversal Exploits (CVE-2024-31204 and CVE-2024-30270)
Mailcow is an open source mail server software suite. CVE-2024-31204 (6.1 medium) XSS in the Admin Panel and CVE-2024-30270 (6.2 medium) arbitrary file overwrite were originally reported by SonarSource. SecureLayer7 performs patch diffing to provide a root cause analysis (proof of concept) for them.

#vulnerability #CVE_2024_31204 #CVE_2024_30270 #mailcow #proofofconcept #CVE

##
